page.title: 04A visit to Dunkirk,Talke
page.content: We were really excited on 16th May 1985.We were going to look around Dunkirk in Clough Hall's minibus.Parrots Druble has been in the Â£Evening Sentinal'.Volinteers from the Staffordshire conservation trust have built a bridge to study wildlife and marshes. Dunkirk Farm,no longer in use,had a boxer dog and some geese.Two mums,Mrs Hughes and Mrs Tipper suggested we sketched here.As we left we came to a field full of rape seed grass.Mr Williams nearly fell into a drainage ditch as he tried to get a rape seed plant.We came across some cottages called Meadowside whitch were a hundred years old.At Bignall End Farm we asked Mrs sellars if we could visit,but she just said no.A final look towards Wedgewoods monument and we returned to school.
